meanings.definition: A person who adjures or solemnly charges another.
meanings.sent1: The adjuror warned the witness to speak only the truth.
meanings.sent2: The adjuror in court asked the defendant to swear to tell the truth.
meanings.sent3: The adjuror playfully pretended to cast a magical spell on the suspect.
meanings.sent4: The adjuror's words carried a weight as heavy as a judge's gavel.
meanings.sent5: The adjuror's gaze was as piercing as a hawk's eyes, demanding honesty.

meanings.definition: One who calls upon a deity or a sacred person to witness or testify to the truth of what is said or to witness the solemnity of an oath.
meanings.sent1: The adjuror prayed to the gods for justice to prevail.
meanings.sent2: The adjuror invoked the name of the divine to bless the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The adjuror humorously asked the heavens to confirm the suspect's guilt.
meanings.sent4: The adjuror's plea to the heavens was as powerful as a thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The adjuror's invocation of the sacred was as pure as a mountain spring.
